runs.comm: full and a bit of curl away has Tamim uncertain about playing it. In the end the ball thuds into his bat as he tries to pull it away and it squirts away to third man
143kph, throws his bat at a full, inswinging delivery outside off. No feet whatsoever though and he's beaten soundly
low full toss, think he was going for an indipping yorker there. Anamul drills it to mid-on with a straight bat
cuts him in half again, this time with the batsman charging him. It's just back of a good length and ducks back in at him.
142kph, shortish on middle and Anamul blocks much more calmly
another one dug in around the off stump and Anamul uses soft hands to dab it towards point
full, on and around off stump. Tamim presses forward and drives to mid-off
poor direction from Coulter-Nile and he's saved a few blushes by a big dive from the keeper. Inswinger goes way down leg
fires it into the blockhole on middle, Tamim digs it out with an angled bat. Gets a thick outside edge to point
slower ball, slides down leg again. Two wides in his first over back in the side.
142kph, back of a length on middle and leg, picked away to deep square leg

simple catch at first slip and Anamul succumbs to a very rash shot! Charged him and swung wildly, that's been his gameplan in this little innings, and it ends with a straightforward snick into the cordon. Reward for a fuller length for Coulter-Nile
back of a length and outside off, steered to point off his toes
full on off stump, he strides forward and pushes to mid-on
the wide bug bits Starc this time. Presents a lovely, good length ball angled across the right-hander... Only it was Tamim on strike
much better. This time he realises it's a leftie and delivers a back of a length delivery that curls away after pitching. Lures a poke from Tamim and beats him
back-to-back beauties and both of them were shorter in length. Gets a bit of help from the pitch as this seams past the outside edge
goes fuller and Tamim prefers it there, moves forward eagerly and drives to mid-off
dug in short and just a shade outside off, Tamim has seen the line and leaves it
nothing wrong with the ball, but Tamim gains some confidence by a solid front foot push. Held his balance as he punches the good length ball on the up and through the covers
full and wide outside off and Shakib races down the track and drills it through the covers. His back foot came off the ground as he had to reach out for it
142kph, sends a very full and very wide delivery that Tamim rightly goes after with a cover drive. Doesn't connect

good length ball around the off stump, Tamim goes for an on-the-up drive again but this time his timing is terrible. Lobs a low catch to mid-off and departs with his head down. He's not had a very good few months recently and that rut continues
141kph, lovely fuller length fetches a little bit of away swing. Gets a thick outside edge to point
shortish and a bit of width outside off, he rides it down to third man. Good bounce off this deck
goes for a lash over the top of the slips, but the bounce on this short ball directed across him is too much
back of a length on and around off stump, blocked into the covers
targets the batsman's ribs, but Mushi's is on the back foot and blocks with soft hands
fullish on and around middle, Mushi presents a straight bat
movement away and it fetches a bit of an outside edge that wanders past a diving second slip. Australia continue exploring a shortish length and deriving just a hint of seam
launced over midwicket! Takes on the bouncer and he's succeeded with some elan! He was on the front foot, but pushed his weight back just enough to swat it away
races down the track and looks to heave down the ground, but misses the fuller delivery curving in at him a bit. Misses the middle bail by inches
shuffles across and nudges this off this thighs to long leg
full on leg stump, Shakib flicks off the front foot but isn't able to beat the lone man at short fine leg. Boundary opportunity goes begging
skips down the track, but Watson keeps him honest by pulling his length back
back of a length on middle, Shakib blocks
comes down the track again and though the bowler tries refuses to let him to get under it, Shakib deflects it off his thighs and past the keeper
offers up a length ball outside off and he's been carted over the long-on boundary. Cleared his front leg and slammed it for the 250th six of the tournament
full and wide yorker, Shakib jams a horizontal bat down on it and steers it to deep point
what a welcome! advances to reach the pitch and hosts the flighted ball over the bowler's head.
isn't afraid of tossing the ball up despite the last ball. Slower pace keeps Shakib to a defensive nudge into the leg side
gets no turn from this angle and he bowls one a little short and wide. Mushi goes back and slaps it into the gap through point. Waited on it nicely and put it away into the gap
picks the good length ball off his pads for a couple through midwicket
lovely flight again from Maxi. The batsman is lured forward and slices it to point
tossed up again, pushed into the covers for a single
comes down the track again, but he strikes this off the bottom of the bat. Fuller delivery outside off dragged to long-on
back of a length on and around off stump, guided with an open face to third man
fullish and just outside off, waits on it nicely and dabs it to third man
rushes at the bowler and though it is bowled short and pushed across him to try and beat his reach, Mushi taps it away behind point
133kph, excellent strike! Short ball, but doesn't rise as high as Bollinger wanted. Shakib though is set on the back foot and swivel pulls it down behind the square leg boundary
fullish and outside off, he drives to mid-off
back of a length on off stump, Mushi goes deep in his crease and works it away behind square leg
full and outside off, Shakib is forward and slaps it through the covers
slower ball, kept full on off stump. Mushi blocks with an open face
races down the track, but Watto's seen him and sends down a short ball outside off. Can't reach it and the keeper fluffs up as well
135 kph, looks for a dab to third man but this wasn't really short enough or wide enough for that
chopes the shortish ball angled in at him to deep third man
too close for a horizontal bat shot, but still manages to tap it down to third man. Not off the middle though

141kph, too quick for him there, and a bit of extra bounce too. It was shortish and around the off stump and Mushi was looking for the typically subcontinental flick to midwicket. Gets truck on the glove as the ball has a bit more sting on it
full on leg stump, but Shakib has played this a little too early. Gets a bit of a leading edge that evades the bowler's left hand
what timing! All he did was come down on the ball with a chop, there was no flourish at all. But it easily beats deep third man

142kph, that's slipped out of his hands! Rather high full toss gets an outside edge that balloons over cover. That was a smidge over the waist and he's gotten away with it. Instant apology from Coulter-Nile
short ball on middle and off, Mushi rocks back and pulls wide of the long leg fielder. Terrific strike
very eager to use his feet against the spinner. Reaches the pitch and drills it down to long-on
flights it and uses a slower pace, Mushi waits and nudges through square leg
beaten in flight but because he went through with the shot, he was able to cart this tossed up delivery outside off to long-on
this sails into the Mirpur crowd! That's how you use you feet, got under the flighted ball and smacks it for an 84m-six over deep midwicket
flighted on and around leg stump, much slower in pace and Mushi nudges it off his pads
short and wide, Shakib backs away and slaps it to the sweeper
chips it over mid-off, who despite making good ground by running back, is not able to get under it. Fuller delivery on off stump hoisted over the infield
short ball and he's been very willing to take them head on. Once again he's quick on the pull and finds the man at deep square leg
141kph, back of a length delivery on leg stump, flicked behind square leg
fullish on leg stump, pushed down the ground to long-on
this has been murdered! Australia's plan of bowling short is backfiring big time! Doesn't matter if he was on the front foot, this sat up and he's pummeled it in front of midwicket
thinks it would be the fuller one and races down the track, but Bollinger double bluffs. Shorter ball directed across him and it bounces much more to beat his slashing blade
slower ball, drags it short and wide outside off. So wide that the batsman's timing is shot as he cuts to deep point
back of a length on off stump, nudged away to mdiwicket who sends in a direct hit. The third umpire is called. He's well in
short ball, he's been quick to pull but has mistimed it. Goes uppishly in the region of mid-on, if it had been there
slower short ball on off stump, dabbed to midwicket with soft hands
length ball, he picks it up and lashes it wide of long-on. Looked like he had smoked it, but he's got too much height on it

lovely ball, doesn't deserve the eventual result. The offcutter was dug in short as he saw the batsman charging at him. Mushi looks to ramp it over third man, but is beaten. The ball bounces before Haddin and spins past him
flighted outside off, and Shakib lashes out with a cover drive. Haddin didn't stay low enough and lets a bye through
flighted outside off, he blocks solidly
gets down on one knee and slog sweeps this flighted ball on middle and leg to deep square leg
goes back and punches the length ball through into the covers
quicker ball slid down the leg side, Shakib flicks it away behind square leg for his fifty
he's overstepped! Length ball on the stumps, picked away into the leg side for a single
thumped straight down the ground! Shakib is motoring along. Gets under this quick dart on middle and heaves it towards the sight screen
short on off stump, he backs away and cuts to deep point
length ball outside off, Shakib slog sweeps to deep midwicket
keeps making room as he charges him and the endeavor throws him off balance and too far away from the short ball outside off to make contact
stays put and pulls this short ball on middle to deep square leg
offers it up on length and outside off, but Shakib's slog goes more off the inside half of the bat. Single to deep midwicket to bring up the 100 partnership
full and wide outside off, Mushi has flayed this through point. Third man is too fine to cut this off. Clean strike
terrific yorker as he followed Shakib, who was backing away outside leg. That's when he's dangerous, when he gets those those big inswinging yorkers
this time the yorker goes wrong. Ends up a wide full toss outside off, nowhere near Mushi's reach
another full toss and this sits up for Mushi to pound over the covers. Should really have beaten that man in the deep
walks across as he bets on Starc going full and straight. Scoops it to long leg, excellent sense of timing from Shakib. Had he missed that he would have been bowled
searing yorker on off stump, Mushi jams down an open face down on it and gets a couple to third man
slower short ball and Mushi was into the pull a little too early, but he had adjusted well enough to have it drop short of the man at long leg
145kph, lovely finish. Yorker on middle stump, kept out quite nicely too
starts off with a full one way down leg. Mushi was looking to lap it away to the fine leg boundary, but can't put bat to ball. Easy wide though
walks at him, but Watson sends down a fuller ball that sneaks between bat and pad. Almost yorked himself as he goes for a flick
went deep in his crease to try and get under this fuller ball on middle, but the slog falls safely into the hands of Maxwell at deep midwicket. Falls short of a well-deserved fifty
fuller delivery pushed way too far across the left-hander, even if he was moving across to off stump
slashed to deep point as this was full and wide outside off again
full delivery on off stump, pushed to long-on
135kph, excellent bouncer! Loads of effort in this as he gets the ball to rise above Shakib's shoulder and defeat his frenetic pull
goes for the wrong option this time. Tries to sneak a wide yorker inside the guideline, but doesn't succeed
full and just outside off, Shakib lashes and the resulting thick outside edge goes on a spree to third man
walks across to lap it fine, but Bollinger's yorker smacks onto his boot. Struck just a shade outside the line, reckons the umpire as he turns down the bowler's appeal
length ball outside off, Shakin reaches out and belts it over the top of mid-off. Terrible bowling for his field

he has struck this quite hard, but Maxwell has pulled off a blinder at deep midwicket. Cleared his legs for a full swing of the bat down on this full ball on middle. It went flat and hard and Maxi runs forward and dives full length to cling on to a low chance
back of a length and pushed across him, he taps with an open face towards point
141kph, short ball on off stump, Mahmudullah keeps to his crease and pulls down to long leg
slower ball, pitched short and outside off. Cut away to deep third man
this is in the slot, made so by Nasir rushing down the track. Gets under it and lifts it over extra cover. No need to slog whatsoever
low full toss, following the batsman who was making room outside leg. Clipped away smartly to deep square leg
very full on middle and leg, Mahmudullah gets a thick inside edge to long leg
138kph, sends down a rather high full toss way wide of the off stump. The batsman advancing has shorted Watson's radar
much better. Finds the yorker even with Nasir moving outside leg stump
flicked away to deep midwicket as he bowls full and on leg stump
ensures the batsman get get too far under the ball as he keeps it full on middle and leg, drilled to long-on
fires it full and just wide of off stump, jammed away to point
presents an angled bat to the fuller ball outside off, finds cover point in the deep
jams in a yorker on middle, dug out down the ground
low full toss outside off, slammed through cover. Bisects the man inside the circle and Maxwell in the deep. Offered room and taken advantage of
slower short ball, again with room on offer. Flat bats it down the ground and they snare a rapid could against David Warner's arm. That's well done!
bowled off the last ball as he was trying to make room! Beaten for pace as he tried to dab it away to third man for at best a single
